pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:5.1: 1. The training rule on collections of bowls
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:6.1: Venerables, these thirty rules on offenses entailing relinquishment and confession come up for recitation.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:7.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:7.2: At that time the nuns from the group of six were collecting a large number of bowls.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:7.3: When people who were walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:7.4: “How can the nuns collect a large number of bowls? Will they start up as bowl merchants or set up a bowl shop?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:8.1: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:8.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:8.3: “How can the nuns from the group of six collect bowls?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:8.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns from the group of six do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:8.7: How can the nuns from the group of six collect bowls?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:8.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:8.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:9.1: ‘If a nun collects bowls, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:10.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:11.2: there are two kinds of bowls: the iron bowl and the ceramic bowl.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:11.3: And there are three kinds of bowls: the large bowl, the medium bowl, and the small bowl.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:11.5: it takes half an _āḷhaka_ measure of rice, a fourth part of non-staple food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:11.7: it takes a _nāḷika_ measure of rice, a fourth part of non-staple food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:11.9: it takes a _pattha_ measure of rice, a fourth part of non-staple food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:11.10: Anything larger than this is not a bowl, nor anything smaller.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:12.2: bowls that have neither been determined nor transferred.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:13.3: The bowl is to be relinquished to the Order of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:13.4: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:13.5: After approaching the Order, that nun should put her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior nuns. She should then squat on her heels, put the palms of her hands together, and say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:13.6: ‘Venerables, this bowl which I have kept more than one day is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Order.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:13.7: After relinquishing it, she is to confess the offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:13.8: The confession should be received by a competent and capable nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:13.9: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:14.1: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:14.2: This bowl which was to be relinquished by nun so-and-so has been relinquished to the Order.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:14.3: If it seems appropriate to the Order, the Order should give this bowl back to nun so-and-so.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:15.1: After approaching several nuns, that nun should put her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior nuns. She should then squat on her heels, put the palms of her hands together, and say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:15.2: ‘Venerables, this bowl which I have kept more than one day is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the venerables.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:15.3: After relinquishing it, she is to confess the offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:15.4: The confession should be received by a competent and capable nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:15.5: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:16.1: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask you to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:16.2: This bowl which was to be relinquished by nun so-and-so has been relinquished to you.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:16.3: If it seems appropriate to you, you should give this bowl back to nun so-and-so.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:17.1: After approaching a single nun, that nun should put her upper robe over one shoulder, squat on her heels, put the palms of her hands together, and say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:17.2: ‘This bowl which I have kept more than one day is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:17.4: After relinquishing it, she is to confess the offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:17.5: The confession should be received by that nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:17.6: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:17.7: ‘I give this bowl back to you.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.1: If it is more than one day and she perceives it as more, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.2: If it is more than one day, but she is unsure if it is, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.3: If it is more than one day, but she perceives it as less, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.4: If the bowl has not been determined, but she perceives it as determined, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.5: If the bowl has not been transferred, but she perceives it as transferred, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.6: If the bowl has not been given away, but she perceives it as given away, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.7: If the bowl has not been lost, but she perceives it as lost …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.8: If the bowl is not destroyed, but she perceives it as destroyed …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.9: If the bowl is not broken, but she perceives it as broken …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:18.10: If the bowl has not been stolen, but she perceives it as stolen, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:19.1: If she uses a bowl which is to be relinquished without first relinquishing it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:19.2: If it is less than one day, but she perceives it as more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:19.3: If it is less than one day, but she is unsure if it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:19.4: If it is less than one day and she perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:20.2: if before dawn it has been determined, transferred, given away, lost, destroyed, broken, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:20.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:21.1: At one time the nuns from the group six did not give back a relinquished bowl.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:21.3: “Monks, a relinquished bowl is not not to be given back.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:21.4: If a nun doesn’t give it back, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:22.1: The first training rule is finished.
